Medics in New York say they have seen a sevenfold increase in stroke cases in people in their 30s and 40s who either had mild or no Covid-19 symptoms at all… [+4692 chars]

articles.author: Philip Murray
articles.title: Three new Covid-19 coronavirus cases confirmed in the Highlands, but numbers in hospital fell; mirroring a similar fall across Scotland as a whole - Inverness Courier
articles.description: Three new cases of Covid-19 have been confirmed in the NHS Highland area, taking the overall total to 214.
articles.content:
Coronavirus news.
THREE new cases of Covid-19 have been confirmed in the NHS Highland area, taking the overall total to 214.
It came as Scotland recorded another 371 cases, taking the overall number since the outbreak began to 9409. Sadly the death toll als… [+1227 chars]

articles.author: Kit Heren
articles.title: Nose cells identified as entry points for coronavirus - Evening Standard
articles.content:
Two nose cells have been identified as the first points at which Covid-19 enters the human body.
Scientists from the Wellcome Sanger Institute in the UK and several other universities have found that these cells contain high levels of the protein that corona… [+1661 chars]

articles.author: Kathleen Speirs
articles.title: 'One in a million' Scots nurse dies from Covid-19 week after telling of 'excruciating' symptoms - Daily Record
articles.description: Great-grandmother Angie Cunningham 'wasn't scared to stand up and be counted when things were tough'.
articles.content:
A 'one in a million' Scots nurse died from covid-19 in the hospital where she worked just days after her 60th birthday. 
 Angela Cunningham, known as Angie, passed away at Borders General Hospital's Intensive Care Unit (ICU) on Wednesday.
